name: fcp
description: Significantly faster alternative to the classic Unix cp(1) command

repo.name: fcp
repo.description: A significantly faster alternative to the classic Unix cp(1) command, copying large files and directories in a fraction of the time.

readme.summary: Excellent documentation with crystal-clear purpose, comprehensive installation options, and impressive benchmarks, though it could benefit from more usage examples and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: Limited troubleshooting section - only mentions SSD optimization but doesn't cover common errors, edge cases, or what to do when operations fail

injection_risks.description: The use of env::args() could potentially lead to issues if the input is not properly sanitized, but in this case it's used for command line arguments which are typically trusted.

The use of format! macro with user-controlled data could lead to potential issues if the input is not properly sanitized, but in this case it's used for error messages which are typically not exploitable.

critical_findings: Potential for path traversal attacks if file paths are not properly sanitized
security.summary: The code has some potential security issues, but they are mostly related to input validation and error handling, and do not appear to be critical.

common_complaints: Compilation errors with recent Rust versions
Performance not meeting expectations in some scenarios
Missing common cp flags (-r, -n, -a, move option)
sentiment.summary: Project shows signs of abandonment with critical build failures unresolved for 2+ months, no maintainer engagement on open issues spanning 4+ years, and feature requests lacking responses despite community interest.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are clear, helpful, and demonstrate a good level of technical depth while maintaining patience with new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6+ months (last commit August 2024)
18 open issues with no resolution activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown or missing last release information
maintenance.summary: The fcp package appears to be abandoned with no maintenance activity for over 6 months and accumulating unresolved issues.

project_metrics.description: A significantly faster alternative to the classic Unix cp(1) command, copying large files and directories in a fraction of the time.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is clear and provides good installation instructions, but lacks in providing a quick start guide, examples, configuration options, and troubleshooting information.
concerns: No commits in the past six months
Open issues and PRs suggest potential problems
Docs: Lack of troubleshooting information and configuration documentation
Community: performance issues on btrfs raid1
Security: Potential for path traversal attacks if file paths are not properly sanitized
High bus factor risk (98% from top contributor)
highlights: Contributors are still active, indicating some level of interest
Recent closed issues and merged PRs show that some progress is being made
